name: Traumatic Aortoenteric Fistula
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain with episodes of vomiting blood
prognosis: Guarded (50-70% mortality even with prompt intervention)
description: A rare life-threatening condition where a communication forms between the aorta and gastrointestinal tract, most commonly between an aortic aneurysm and the duodenum. Typically occurs in patients with prior aortic graft placement. Presents with herald bleeding followed by catastrophic hemorrhage.
